heading: 1.2 Read the frequency list
text:
many corpora Portuguese texts online, e.g., http://www.nilc.icmc.usp.br/nilc/tools/corpora.htm.many corpora Portuguese texts online, e.g., http://www.nilc.icmc.usp.br/nilc/tools/corpora.htm.use frequency list 
http://www.nilc.icmc.usp.br/nilc/download/frequencia.zipWe use frequency list 
http://www.nilc.icmc.usp.br/nilc/download/frequencia.zipWe downloaded file. Now read tibble:

fl <- read_csv('./data/nilc-frequencia.csv') %>% 
  transmute(
    palavra = Palavra,
    freq = Frequencia
  )
## Rows: 340016 Columns: 3
## ── Column specification ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr (1): Palavra
## dbl (2): Frequencia, CÓD
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` retrieve full column specification data.
## ℹ Specify column types set `show_col_types = FALSE` quiet message.downloaded file. Now read tibble:structure:

fl %>% glimpse()
## Rows: 340.016
## Columns: 2
## $ palavra <chr> "aaaadoooreeeii", "aaaagauuucug", "aaaah", "aaaaiiii", "aaaamplo", …
## $ freq    <dbl> 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 18, 29, 3, 28, 1, 108, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 34, 2…structure:use n_words frequent words:

n_words <- 3e4We use n_words frequent words:also discard one-letter words.

fl <- fl %>% 
  slice_max(
    order_by = freq,
    n = n_words
  ) %>% 
  filter(
    nchar(palavra) > 1
  )also discard one-letter words.tibble now:

fl %>% glimpse()
## Rows: 30.212
## Columns: 2
## $ palavra <chr> "de", "que", "", "da", "em", "para", "", "os", "um", "com", "nã…
## $ freq    <dbl> 1701990, 782252, 664119, 586378, 477583, 388861, 325882, 321033, 31…tibble now:summary frequencies:

fl$freq %>% summary()
##      Min.   1st Qu.    Median      Mean   3rd Qu.      Max. 
##      54,0      85,0     157,0     982,8     411,0 1701990,0Here summary frequencies:sample words, order decreasing frequency:

sample_size <- 100
fl %>% 
  slice_sample(n = sample_size) %>% 
  arrange(desc(freq)) %>% 
  pull(palavra) %>%
  paste0(collapse = '\n') %>%
  cat()

  write_lines(
    './data/nilc-words.txt',

## Warning vroom_write(x, file = file, delim = "", col_names = FALSE, eol = eol, :
## NAs introduced coercionWe write words file, processed list can handled markovchain functions:
code:
fl <- read_csv('./data/nilc-frequencia.csv') %>% 
  transmute(
    palavra = Palavra,
    freq = Frequencia
  )## Rows: 340016 Columns: 3
## ── Column specification ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Delimiter: ","
## chr (1): Palavra
## dbl (2): Frequencia, CÓD
## 
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
fl %>% glimpse()## Rows: 340.016
## Columns: 2
## $ palavra <chr> "aaaadoooreeeii", "aaaagauuucug", "aaaah", "aaaaiiii", "aaaamplo", …
## $ freq    <dbl> 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 18, 29, 3, 28, 1, 108, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 34, 2…
n_words <- 3e4
fl <- fl %>% 
  slice_max(
    order_by = freq,
    n = n_words
  ) %>% 
  filter(
    nchar(palavra) > 1
  )
fl %>% glimpse()## Rows: 30.212
## Columns: 2
## $ palavra <chr> "de", "que", "do", "da", "em", "para", "no", "os", "um", "com", "nã…
## $ freq    <dbl> 1701990, 782252, 664119, 586378, 477583, 388861, 325882, 321033, 31…
fl$freq %>% summary()##      Min.   1st Qu.    Median      Mean   3rd Qu.      Max. 
##      54,0      85,0     157,0     982,8     411,0 1701990,0
sample_size <- 100
fl %>% 
  slice_sample(n = sample_size) %>% 
  arrange(desc(freq)) %>% 
  pull(palavra) %>%
  paste0(collapse = '\n') %>%
  cat()## nacional

heading: 1.3 Process the list
text:
want define wordlist variable, R list character vectors.want define wordlist variable, R list character vectors.vector contain characters word, added ‘^’ beginning two added ’$’s end.vector contain characters word, added ‘^’ beginning two added ’$’s end.markovchain package gets confused state names containing accented characters, first preprocess words, converting accented characters pairs characters:
‘á’ becomes ‘´’
‘ç’ becomes ‘c,’

markovchain package gets confused state names containing accented characters, first preprocess words, converting accented characters pairs characters:‘á’ becomes ‘´’‘ç’ becomes ‘c,’onThe following awk code read dictionary produce R script define variable wordlist:
BEGIN {
    accented["á"] = "´" 
    accented["à"] = "`" 
    accented["â"] = "^" 
    accented["ã"] = "~" 
    accented["ä"] = ":" 
    accented["ç"] = "c," 
    accented["é"] = "e´" 
    accented["è"] = "e`" 
    accented["ê"] = "e^" 
    accented["í"] = "´" 
    accented["ó"] = "o´" 
    accented["ô"] = "o^" 
    accented["õ"] = "o~" 
    accented["ú"] = "u´" 
    accented["ü"] = "u:" 
    accented["ñ"] = "n~" 

    print("wordlist <- list(") > "wordlist.R"
}

{
    word = tolower($0)

    # Split word array chars
    split(word, vector, "")

    # Replace accented chars
    (vector) {
        new = accented[vector[]]
        (new != "")
            vector[] = new
    }

    # Output vector R notation
    printf("  c('^', ") > "wordlist.R" 
    (vector) printf("'%s', ", vector[]) > "wordlist.R" 
    printf("'$', '$'),\n") > "wordlist.R" 
}

# Insert NA just last comma ,
# remove 
END {
    print("  NA\n)\n") > "wordlist.R" 
    print("wordlist <- wordlist[-length(wordlist)]") > "wordlist.R" 
}following awk code read dictionary produce R script define variable wordlist:execute R script, defining wordlist variable:

source('wordlist.R')execute R script, defining wordlist variable:first elements wordlist:

head(wordlist, 10)
## [[1]]
## [1] "^" "d" "e" "$" "$"
## 
## [[2]]
## [1] "^" "q" "u" "e" "$" "$"
## 
## [[3]]
## [1] "^" "d" "o" "$" "$"
## 
## [[4]]
## [1] "^" "d" "" "$" "$"
## 
## [[5]]
## [1] "^" "e" "m" "$" "$"
## 
## [[6]]
## [1] "^" "p" "" "r" "" "$" "$"
## 
## [[7]]
## [1] "^" "n" "o" "$" "$"
## 
## [[8]]
## [1] "^" "o" "s" "$" "$"
## 
## [[9]]
## [1] "^" "u" "m" "$" "$"
## 
## [[10]]
## [1] "^" "c" "o" "m" "$" "$"first elements wordlist:
code:
BEGIN {
    accented["á"] = "a´" 
    accented["à"] = "a`" 
    accented["â"] = "a^" 
    accented["ã"] = "a~" 
    accented["ä"] = "a:" 
    accented["ç"] = "c," 
    accented["é"] = "e´" 
    accented["è"] = "e`" 
    accented["ê"] = "e^" 
    accented["í"] = "i´" 
    accented["ó"] = "o´" 
    accented["ô"] = "o^" 
    accented["õ"] = "o~" 
    accented["ú"] = "u´" 
    accented["ü"] = "u:" 
    accented["ñ"] = "n~" 

    print("wordlist <- list(") > "wordlist.R"
}

{
    word = tolower($0)

    # Split the word into array of chars
    split(word, vector, "")

    # Replace accented chars
    for (i in vector) {
        new = accented[vector[i]]
        if (new != "")
            vector[i] = new
    }

    # Output vector in R notation
    printf("  c('^', ") > "wordlist.R" 
    for (i in vector) printf("'%s', ", vector[i]) > "wordlist.R" 
    printf("'$', '$'),\n") > "wordlist.R" 
}

# Insert this NA just because of the last comma above,
# then remove it
END {
    print("  NA\n)\n") > "wordlist.R" 
    print("wordlist <- wordlist[-length(wordlist)]") > "wordlist.R" 
}
source('wordlist.R')
head(wordlist, 10)## [[1]]
## [1] "^" "d" "e" "$" "$"
## 
## [[2]]
## [1] "^" "q" "u" "e" "$" "$"

## [1] "^" "d" "o" "$" "$"
## 
## [[4]]
## [1] "^" "d" "a" "$" "$"
## 
## [[5]]
## [1] "^" "e" "m" "$" "$"
## 
## [[6]]
## [1] "^" "p" "a" "r" "a" "$" "$"
## 
## [[7]]
## [1] "^" "n" "o" "$" "$"
## 
## [[8]]
## [1] "^" "o" "s" "$" "$"
## 
## [[9]]
